out of curiosity though have any of you guys had your plane just spontaneously dissasemble itself as soon as you get onto the runway? im not talking about explosions or anything the plane literally just turns into a pile of components the moment the scene loads as if none of them were ever part of the same vehicle. was one of the many reasons i gave up with my first attempts, it was repeatedly happening to me. and its not like i dont know how to use struts either.

@TrainEngie Level Flight is when you aircraft is flying at altitude, but is not gaining or loosing altitude while doing so. Or at least as close to this as you can get in game.

well at this point i think im going to throw in the towell. i may submit a basic form of my bomber but frankly im just getting annoyed with the kraken, simply put i have a scalable multi hull design with space to trade cargo space for fuel to make it an SSTO and capable of moon bombing

the design is scalable with each additional set of hulls increasing carry capacity, TWR and range. however the kraken has now decided to occupy the SPH as well as outdoors so constructing it has become impossible (missing textures,placing multiple components in the same spot, the staging tree bugging out and not being able to select components, 64bit is even worse with a game crash the moment i try to load it so honestly i think this is a nogo. at this point it is simply unfeasable to continue i may try and use a cut down version with a 20 bomb payload and orbital capabilities but im not sure i would be happy submitting it as the design was based on something so much more.

Yo listen up: here's a light and cheap bomber!

EKRANOPLAN 1 (it can't float despite what its name suggests)

Light Bomber (6 bombs)

REQUIREMENTS!

Take off and land with and without payload on the KSC runway: Yes, sir!

Six full FLT-400 bombs: Yes, sir!

Bombs are in a cargo bay: Yes, sir!

Payload can be dropped safely: Yes, sir!

Bomber can take off, cruise, bomb the peninsula, and fly back to KSC: Yes, sir!

BONUS POINTS!

Swift Payback: 165 m/s at 3100 m, so 165 x 0.1 = 16.5 points!

Engine Maintenance: 4 Basic Jets, 4 x -2 = -8 points.

Part Maintenance: 218 parts, 218 x -0.02 = -4.36 points.

Gentle Giant: Looking at the Navball, it looks like 4 degrees because the pointer and the prograde are just pixels away from 5 degrees. 20 points!

Service ceiling: Yes, sir! 15 points!

TOTAL POINTS: 39.14 points! Mission time: 41 minutes 39 seconds

Cost to build this bomber: 112,268 funds. Tell me if someone's plane is cheaper.

Sir, you are on.

To round out the product range, I'm presenting a light, medium-range, pseudo-stealth VTOL bomber with an appropriately excessive powertrain - the **Allii Ren Touare**.

Carrying the standard complement of six FLT400 bombs, it is capable of short and medium range precision and strategic bombing and rapid air interdiction at ranges of up to 500km (maybe even more), it is yours for the low low price of 73 thousand funds. It also contains only 140 parts, making field maintenance a breeze.

[Check out the blueprints for more details (download)](http://kerbalx.com/juzeris/Allii%20Ren%20Touare).

[Swift payback - 168 m/s](http://i.imgur.com/U9Zz6M5.png): +16.8

Engine maintenance - 2 jets and 3 turbojets: -16

[Part maintenance - 140](http://i.imgur.com/WcNnlVH.png): -2.8

[Airshow maneuverability](http://imgur.com/a/vSFJs): +10

Gentle giant - no, 6 degrees, unless it counts with VTOL engines on, which I do keep engaged until reasonable altitudes, 12 km or so.

EDIT: I'm claiming [gentle giant with the VTOL engines on](http://i.imgur.com/UNWyvR3.png), same as wossname ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif): +20

[Flashy technology and where eagles dare](http://imgur.com/a/gwncJ): +30+30=+60

Service ceiling - oh yes: +15

Field refueling - no, totally forgot about it

[Battle duck - yes, if very carefully](http://imgur.com/a/0uq73): +20

Such stealth, very sneak - yes, if this ain't, I don't know what is: +2

**Total: 125** exactly

Mission time - 14:38

Operating manual:

Action groups: 1 - middle turbojet, 2 - two side turbojets, 3 - VTOL jets, 4 - close 90% of air intakes (lower drag), 6 - ladder, 9 - bomb bay door

The VTOL jets provide just barely enough thrust to leave the ground, even at full thrust she'll be essentially hovering with full payload.

The bombs are a bit cramped in the bomb bay, and can get stuck when dropped. Or one may explode if dropped at higher speeds.
